headline: 2024 Presidential Election New Nyt Poll Finds Trump And Harris Neck And Neck
summary: A new poll fromThe New York Times (Lean Left bias)and Siena College found former President Donald Trump narrowly leading Vice President Kamala Harris among nationwide voters, 48% to 47%.The Details:The poll, which carries a 2.8% margin of error, was conducted from September 3 to 6 and surveyed 1,695 voters. It found Harris to lead Trump in Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, and Michigan, while the two are virtually tied in Nevada, Georgia, Arizona, and North Carolina.For Context:Since formally announcing her campaign in July, Harris has seen a surge in popularity, which was capped off by the Democratic National Convention in Chicago last month.Key Quote:Trump spokesperson Jason Miller toldPolitico (Lean Left bias), “The honeymoon is officially over. Kamala Harris has been exposed as a Radical Left individual who owns the destruction of our economy and our border.”How The Media Covered It:Outlets across the spectrum noted that Harris’ momentum from August has ostensibly stalled, but Politico noted ina headlinethat it hasn’t necessarily reversed. Both The Times andFox News (Right bias)noted that the results are similar to the last NYT/Siena poll, which came in late July. The Times wrote that the poll’s findings demonstrate that Trump’s support “remains remarkably resilient.”
